text:
Hello,

Are you guys aware of any API endpoint that let's me enroll a company into a workflow?

I am trying to put a logic in place, each time a deal is enrolled in a workflow, i need to increment a certain property on the associated company by 1.
Hi <@U25PYL3Q8> He is trying to upload file as well as make it PUBLICly available on the same page
Unrelated to API, but couldn't this be achieved by increasing the deal property within the worklow, then using the 'copy property value' action, and copying to the company?

Hello team :wave:

I'm trying to do the migration of one of our public apps to using OAuth. We would make it private but we make use of custom timeline events so we'll have to keep it was public for the time being.

One thing I've noticed is that there are a number of calls we use which do not seem to be available without using an API key and I was wondering how I can migrate if that is the case. I am potentially just missing something.

Calls are:
• GET /crm/v3/timeline/{appId}/event-templates
• DELETE /crm/v3/timeline/{appId}/event-templates/{eventTemplateId}
• POST /crm/v3/timeline/{appId}/event-templates
• PUT /crm/v3/timeline/{appId}/event-templates/{eventTemplateId}
Any help would be greatly appreciated
Thanks, <@U01QVR44MEY>, I'll have a to take a look at GraphQL.
For sure, let me know how it goes

Unfortunately at this time we don’t have an API to directly enroll a company (or any non-contact object) into a workflow. It’s something we’re aware of and plan to support in the future, but no current timeline to share.

Logan’s suggestion could work. We’re also working on some features right now that could make this possible without needing to use an API, which I hope will be available in the next couple of months/by the end of this year.

Hi everyone

I'm trying to get invoice properties using OAuth tokens from an account but the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties|API client> response says something like "That information is not available for public use".
Any ideas on what's going on here? Am I using the wrong scope?
Some api's don't allow for OAuth tokens, like if you try to create a custom object you'll get that same error (there's a beta you can enroll you're app in that will fix this though)
Developer API keys aren't being sunsetted
Just account API Keys. All the above calls require developer api keys

Also unrelated to the api (thanks for clarifying Angus). You could just setup a calculated property called number of associated objects and the calculation would be the sum of objects that have a createdate
Are you uploading the files using formdata?
Have you seen this article? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/migrate-an-existing-ecommerce-bridge-api-integration>
Basically you'll need to store the unique object id from your system in a HubSpot (hasUniqueValue) property
Then you'll need to store the HubSpot object id in your system
Then you'll just setup webhooks to keep the two systems in sync.
going to need to use the api and a workflow or some other stuff to make that happen
Yeah, that's what I was thinking. I don't think is necessary but just out of curiosity, how do I enroll my app in the beta you mentioned?
Thanks so much for your answer :slightly_smiling_face:
Just got the confirmation that they will retry with a 429 response. Still not positive I trust that though…
I also think I’m going to be able to get the contact ID stored as a custom external identifier in Attentive, so then I’ll be able to cut out all of the search API calls.
This message was deleted.
I just tested this and it works fine

I used this endpoint:
`<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/objects/0-1/{contactid}/associations/0-2>`
No uploading using API
